attributes.action: Do not increase the minimum income requirement for family visas to £38,700
attributes.additional_details: Increasing the income requirement to more than twice the minimum wage is unprecedented. No  other country in the world has such a harsh requirement. As family visa holders are already not entitled to public funds, the argument that it prevents them being a drain on the state is plainly wrong. This policy goes well above making sure families are able to support themselves and essentially restricts the right to a foreign partner to the wealthiest in our society. This must be reversed.
attributes.background: On 4th December the government announced their new immigration strategy. This includes increasing the minimum annual income requirement for family visas to £38,700. This is an increase of more than 100% on the present level of £18,600.
